attributes.action: Chancellor to provide adequate support for sole directors and self employed
attributes.additional_details:
The owners of small businesses, self-employed and sole directors, with or without an independent business addresses, have not received adequate financial support through the Coronavirus crisis. 

The Chancellor is proving to be neglegent by not supporting this sector appropriately 

The Chancellor is being asked to review the support package for small businesses and consider the implications this will have on many families. A suitable financial support package is needed urgently
attributes.background: Rishi Sunak neglects his responsibility by not providing adequate support to sole directors or self-employed workers during the Coronavirus crisis. His deliberate ignorance towards hard working, tax paying citizens is draconian and considered by some, as barbaric. Financial support is needed NOW

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions calling for the same action.

Pay self employed workers a wage due to lack or earnings caused by COVID-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/303345

Provide COVID19 income support for the newly self-employed, without HMRC records: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310471

Remove the £50k earnings limit for self-employed to access government funding: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310455

Coronavirus Support Package for Directors / Shareholders of small Limited Co's: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310515

Get HMRC to refund the Self-Employed their Jan 2020 1st Tax Payment on Account: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/304995

Bring forward COVID-19 Self-employment grants to April 2020: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310898
